intro: Vernonia manongarivensis, commonly known as the Manongariva Vernonia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and is adapted to the region's tropical climate. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow to brown flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
